page.title: 16History of Charborough Park
page.content: Charborough House is set within a deerpark of some 300 acres. It is bounded by a{brick wall}which was built along the Wimborne/Dorchester Turnpike road and also along the road to Lytchett Matravers. The entrances into the park are : The Peacock Lodge and archway, 1837, the Lion Gate, 1840, the Stag Gate, 1840, East Almer Lodge, 1840/42, all on the Turnpike road, and Boar Hill Lodge on the road to Lytchett. The{tower}in the High Wood was built in 1790, and damaged by lightening in 1838 and rebuilt and heightened in 1839. There is a{chapel of ease used during the Summer for occasional services. The Drax family mausoleum is full.
